org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.upgradeTests

Class UpgradeChange

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase
            • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.upgradeTests.UpgradeChange
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicSetup, Changes10_1, Changes10_10, Changes10_11, Changes10_12, Changes10_13, Changes10_2, Changes10_3, Changes10_4, Changes10_5, Changes10_6, Changes10_7, Changes10_9

    abstract class UpgradeChange
extends BaseJDBCTestCase
    Abstract class to provide support for test fixtures for upgrade change testing.

      (package private) static java.lang.String SQLSTATE_NEED_UPGRADE

    • Field Detail

      • phase

        static final java.lang.ThreadLocal<java.lang.Integer> phase
        Thread local for the phase of the test set. Contains an Integer object.

      • oldVersion

        static final java.lang.ThreadLocal<int[]> oldVersion
        Thread local for the old version of the engine. Contains a int array with four entries corresponding to the four part Derby number.

      • SQLSTATE_NEED_UPGRADE

        static final java.lang.String SQLSTATE_NEED_UPGRADE
        SWL state thrown when a feature requires upgrade to a newer version and thus cannot be run in soft upgrade mode.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PH_POST_HARD_UPGRADE

        static final int PH_POST_HARD_UPGRADE
        Boot the database with old release after hard upgrade. Expected to fail to connect, so no tests need to have cases for this condition.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getPhase

        final int getPhase()
        Get the phase of the upgrade sequence we are running. One of PH_CREATE, PH_SOFT_UPGRADE, PH_POST_SOFT_UPGRADE, PH_HARD_UPGRADE, PH_POST_HARD_UPGRADE.
